content: The Ravens are hiring Bears offensive coordinator Declan Doyle as their offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter. Doyle, 29, will be the youngest offensive playcaller in the NFL.

content: Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has openly admitted that he and the country's Army Chief, Field Marshal Asim Munir, had to travel to nations to ask for financial help.

title: Alcohol, Snacks, And A Double Murder By Eatery Staff In Ghaziabad
content: A fight over snacks and alcohol at an eatery in Ghaziabad escalated on Friday, leading to the death of two men and leaving another injured.

title: US Government Shuts Down As Budget Approval Misses Funding Deadline
content: The US government entered a partial shutdown Saturday as a midnight funding deadline passed without Congress approving a 2026 budget.

title: Sharad Pawar's Big Remark On Sunetra Pawar Getting Deputy Post
content: The decision to make Sunetra Pawar Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra was taken by the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) and the family was not consulted, said Ajit Pawar's uncle and NCP-SP Chief, Sharad Pawar.

title: Bill Gates Caught STD After Sex With Russian Girls, Claim Epstein Files
content: Among the newly released files are draft emails that appear to have been written by Epstein. The emails include claims accusing Gates of attempting to conceal an STD from his then-wife, following alleged sex with "Russian girls".

title: Satellite Photos Show Activity At Iran Nuclear Sites Amid Protest Crackdown
content: As tensions soar over Iran's crackdown on nationwide protests, satellite images show activity at two Iranian nuclear sites bombed last year by Israel and the US that may be a sign of Tehran trying to obscure efforts to salvage any materials.

title: Filmmaker Mira Nair, Zohran Mamdani's Mother, Mentioned In Epstein Files
content: New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani's mother, Mira Nair, attended an afterparty at convicted sex trafficker Ghislaine Maxwell's house for her 2009 film "Amelia", reveals a new set of Epstein files.

title: Frigid Cold At Launch Site Delays NASA's 1st Artemis Moonshot With Astronauts
content: NASA has delayed astronauts' upcoming trip to the moon because of near-freezing temperatures expected at the launch site.

title: Nestle Acknowledges Delay Before Baby Milk Recall
content: Swiss food giant Nestle has acknowledged that it waited days for a health-risk analysis before alerting authorities after detecting a toxin in its baby milk at a Dutch factory.

title: 'Sanctuary Cities' On Front Line Of Trump Immigration Crackdown
content: US cities that protect their undocumented migrant residents have been thrust into the spotlight by the Trump administration's aggressive immigration crackdown, currently targeting Minneapolis.

title: Lakhs Face Another Arctic Blast Without Power As East Coast Preps For New Storm
content: As tens of thousands of people endured nearly a week with no electricity, another storm loomed on the East Coast where residents braced for near-hurricane force winds, heavy snow and potential flooding.

title: "Come Home": J&K Woman's Last Plea To Terrorist Son Goes Unheard
content: Jana Begum's final wish months ago went unheeded by her son Riaz Ahmed, who joined the ranks of the Hizbul Mujahideen, never to return home.

content: King Charles III's brother Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor appeared to invite Jeffrey Epstein to Buckingham Palace shortly after the late sex offender was released from house arrest.

title: US Justice Dept Opens Civil Rights Probe Into Alex Pretti Shooting
content: The U.S. Justice Department has started a civil rights investigation intothe fatal shooting of Alex Pretti by a federal immigration officer in Minneapolis, a senior official said.

title: Kevin Warsh: From Crisis-Era Fed Governor To Trump's Preferred Chair
content: President Donald Trump says he'll tap former Federal Reserve governor Kevin Warsh as the next Fed chair to replace Jerome Powell in May ‚Äî with Trump believing that he can finally get the booming economy that he promised to voters.

title: Jeff Bezos's Blue Origin To 'Pause' Space Tourism To Focus On Moon Efforts
content: Jeff Bezos's space company Blue Origin said Friday it would temporarily pause flights of its space tourism rocket to focus more resources on its lunar ambitions.

title: Trump, Bill Gates, Elon Musk: Notable Names In Epstein File Dump
content: A fresh cache of files related to the investigation into the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein contains documents that reference President Donald Trump and other high-profile figures.

title: Red Fort Blast Module Planned Attacks On Global Coffee Chain: Sources
content: The probe into the car blast near Delhi's Red Fort on November 10 last year has exposed a much larger terror plan, with the sources saying the same module had plotted attacks on outlets of a global coffee chain.

title: Blog: Blog | Sunetra Pawar: From Behind The Scenes To Pinnacle Of Power
content: Right now, the spotlight is not on a seasoned politician from the Pawar family, but a face that has spent decades observing the machinery of governance from behind the scenes: Sunetra Pawar, affectionately known as 'vahini' (sister-in-law).

title: US Approves Arms Sales To Israel Worth $6.67 Billion And To Saudi Worth $9 Billion
content: The Trump administration has approved a massive new series of arms sales to Israel totaling $6.67 billion and to Saudi Arabia worth $9 billion.

title: 'Ajit left us before ... ': Sharad Pawar's big NCP merger remark ahead of Sunetra's oath
content: Sharad Pawar revealed merger talks between NCP factions were advanced before Ajit Pawar's death, aiming to fulfill his nephew's wish. He denied prior knowledge of Sunetra Pawar's potential deputy CM role, stating decisions are made in Mumbai without his consultation. Pawar also dismissed speculation about joining the NDA.

title: Shehbaz Sharif, Asim Munir 'quietly' visited countries to seek loans for Pakistan
content: Pakistan's prime minister Shehbaz Sharif revealed a difficult truth. He and Army Chief Asim Munir sought billions in loans from friendly nations. This was done quietly to bridge the country's external financing gap. Sharif acknowledged the compromises involved in seeking such aid. China was a key supporter. Pakistan has a history of relying on the IMF for financial support.

title: 'If team management replaces Sanju Samson with Ishan Kishan ... ': Ex-India star speaks out
content: Sanju Samson faces immense pressure in the final T20I against New Zealand, needing a strong performance to silence critics amid a lean patch. Former player Irfan Pathan advocates for Samson's consistent batting order placement, while also highlighting the importance of players like Tilak Varma for team balance and temperament.

title: Foul air causing deaths? ‚ÄòYes‚Äô, ‚Äòcan‚Äôt say‚Äô: 2 govt arms take differing stands
content: Divergent views from governmental bodies regarding air pollution are creating waves. The Environment Ministry argues that there's a lack of decisive evidence tying pollution to actual deaths, while the Indian Council of Medical Research puts forth alarming statistics, claiming over 1.2 million fatalities in 2017 due to air quality issues.

title: The 2025 iPhone that may not get a successor in 2026
content: Apple's highly anticipated iPhone Air, launched last year as the thinnest iPhone ever, may not see a second generation in 2026. Reports suggest a delay due to a global memory chip crunch, with Apple prioritizing premium models and a foldable iPhone for 2026 launches. The standard iPhone 18 is also reportedly pushed to 2027.

title: Bank holidays in February 2026: When and where will banks remain closed
content: Planning a bank visit in February 2026? Be aware of closures in Sikkim on Feb 18 for Losar, Maharashtra on Feb 19 for Shivaji Jayanti, and Mizoram/Arunachal Pradesh on Feb 20 for State Day. Remember, banks also close on the second and fourth Saturdays. Digital services remain active for your convenience.

title: 'Bit her face, hands and legs': CCTV captures horrific dog attack in Bengaluru
content: A morning walk turned terrifying for Shalini Dubey in HSR Layout when a dog attacked her, causing facial and neck injuries. Her husband filed a complaint against the owner, Amaresh Reddy, for negligence. Police have booked Reddy under relevant sections of the BNS for allowing his pet to roam freely, leading to the unprovoked assault.

title: Digital life, real heart risk: How to keep heart safe in 24/7 non-stop world
content: Our constant screen use is a hidden health threat. It leads to physical problems like high blood pressure and heart issues. This stress builds up slowly, often unnoticed. Experts warn that this digital strain affects sleep, movement, and overall well-being. Awareness is low because the danger feels ordinary. Simple changes can protect your heart.

title: ‚ÄòThere‚Äôs a different route‚Äô: Google CEO shares photo of Alex Honnold climbing Taipei 101
content: Climber Alex Honnold achieved a historic feat by free-soloing Taiwan's Taipei 101 skyscraper.  He ascended the 508-meter building without ropes or safety gear.  The climb took about an hour and a half.  Google CEO Sundar Pichai shared photos of the event.  Honnold is known for his daring climbs.

title: 'Nahi khelenge': India-Pakistan T20 World Cup final faces shock twist
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Rashid Latif feels Pakistan acted late on the T20 World Cup 2026 issue. The Pakistan Cricket Board awaits government clearance for participation.  Latif suggests the window for a significant protest has closed.  Pakistan's squad departure is scheduled, indicating participation.  A final decision is expected soon.

title: Retired Air Force officer shot by unidentified assailants at Lucknow restaurant
content: A retired Indian Air Force officer, Awadhesh Kumar Pathak, was critically injured after being shot by two unidentified assailants at his restaurant in Lucknow. The incident occurred Friday night, with the victim sustaining a bullet wound. Police are investigating all possible angles, including personal enmity and business rivalry, and are reviewing CCTV footage to identify the attackers.

title: Inside CJ Roy's luxury car collection: 12 Rolls-Royce, Bugatti, Lamborghinis
content: Real estate tycoon CJ Roy has died. His family blames income tax officials from Kerala for his death. Roy, owner of Confident Group, was under investigation. He had a large social media following. His last post was for Republic Day. The family is expected to arrive in Bengaluru soon. Investigations into the circumstances are ongoing.

title: Tim Cook explains why Apple chose Google, not OpenAI, for the new Siri
content: Apple has chosen Google's advanced Gemini AI for its new Siri and upcoming Apple Intelligence features, prioritizing superior technology over OpenAI. CEO Tim Cook emphasized this collaboration, assuring users of continued privacy standards. While OpenAI's ChatGPT integration remains, it's now seen as secondary. Apple views this AI integration as a significant value creator and potential revenue stream.

title: India-US trade deal: Piyush Goyal shares update; ‚Äòevery country has to‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: India's Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal expressed no disappointment over delays in the India-US trade deal, emphasizing that each nation prioritizes its interests. He confirmed ongoing friendly negotiations, suggesting a potential conclusion this year.  Goyal highlighted India's commitment to fair trade and safeguarding its economic sensitivities, even as it pursues other FTAs.

title: Declare cow ‚Äòrajya mata‚Äô, ban beef export in 40 days: Hindu seer dares UP CM Yogi
content: Swami Avimukteshwaranand has challenged Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath to declare the cow 'state mother' and ban beef exports within 40 days. Failure to do so, he warned, will lead to saints gathering in Lucknow on March 11 to label the CM a 'fake Hindu'. The seer emphasized cow protection and dharma as true tests of being Hindu.

title: 'Border 2' marches towards Rs 350 crore mark worldwide
content: Sunny Deol's 'Border 2' continues its box office dominance, crossing Rs 300 crore worldwide within its first week. Despite a slight dip on weekdays, the film collected Rs 11 crore on its eighth day, heading towards the Rs 350 crore mark. The war drama has garnered Rs 235.25 crore net in India and Rs 322.5 crore globally.

title: Doctor explains the strange pattern of pain that waits for the lights to go off
content: Nighttime pain is a common experience, often dismissed as a nuisance. However, this persistent discomfort can signal underlying health conditions. Experts explain that rest at night can worsen pain from muscle and joint degeneration, nerve issues, or gastrointestinal problems. Persistent nighttime pain, especially with other symptoms, requires medical attention. Ignoring this pain means the body's signals go unheard.

title: India to buy oil from Venezuela instead of Russia? US pitch to counter 25% tariffs
content: The US has permitted India to resume Venezuelan oil purchases, aiming to reduce its reliance on Russian crude. This move is part of a broader US strategy to redirect India's energy imports away from Russia amidst growing pressure and trade costs. India is set to significantly cut Russian crude imports in the coming months, diversifying its supply sources.

title: Budget 2026 on February 1: Will NSE, BSE remain open for trading on Sunday?
content: Indian stock markets will operate on Sunday, February 1, 2026, for the Union Budget presentation, a rare occurrence. Both BSE and NSE confirmed normal trading hours, with only specialized sessions like T+0 settlement suspended. This marks the first Sunday Budget presentation since 2000, while the year's holiday schedule remains unchanged.

title: Pawar play: Speedy decision on Sunetra as deputy CM to pre-empt takeover by NCP (SP)?
content: Sunetra Pawar's appointment as deputy chief minister is a strategic move by senior NCP leaders to preemptively quell leadership speculation following her husband's passing. This decision, endorsed by Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, aims to stabilize the political landscape before the potential merger of NCP factions, ensuring control amidst potential demands from Sharad Pawar's camp.

title: WWE Royal Rumble 2026 start time, match card, venue, date and how to watch
content: WWE Royal Rumble 2026 is set for a historic debut in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, featuring two namesake Rumble matches and a blockbuster Undisputed WWE Championship bout. AJ Styles faces a career-threatening match against Gunther, while Roman Reigns and Brock Lesnar are confirmed for the men's Rumble. The event promises surprise returns and debuts, making it a must-watch spectacle.

title: Bengaluru police inspector caught taking Rs 4 lakh bribe, video goes viral
content: A police inspector, Govindaraju, was caught accepting a Rs 4 lakh bribe in Bengaluru. A video surfaced showing him resisting arrest by Lokayukta officials. He allegedly demanded Rs 5 lakh to help a complainant in a cheating case, having already received Rs 1 lakh prior.

title: 'Made from synthetic material': CBI rules out mixing of animal fats in Tirupati laddu ghee
content: A CBI chargesheet revealed that ghee supplied to Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) was synthetic, not cow ghee, and blended with vegetable oils. Laboratory tests indicated very low milk fat content and the presence of palm oil and/or palm kernel oil. The report suggested the absence of cholesterol made tallow, lard, and fish oil presence very low.

title: Budget 2026 expectations: From HAL to BEL - top defence stocks to watch out for
content: Defence sector stocks: On the whole, the upcoming Indian defence budget outlook, would see ‚Äúcapital step-up‚Äù with at least a 15% increase. Where the structural reality of committed liabilities, would support of a multi-year award cycle.

title: 'Schitt's Creek' actress Catherine O'Hara passes away at 71
content: With deep sadness, we announce the passing of the beloved Canadian actress Catherine O'Hara at the age of 71, following a short illness. Renowned for her unforgettable performances in iconic films like 'Home Alone' and the hit series 'Schitt's Creek,' Catherine's talent blossomed over an impressive career that spanned five decades.

title: Jan AQI worse than last year‚Äôs: Why rain failed to wash away Delhi's pollution pain
content: Despite receiving 33% excess rainfall, January 2026 was more polluted than the previous year, with an average AQI of 307 compared to 305. The month experienced severe air quality days from January 17-19, a first in four years. While the last week saw improvement due to rain, adverse meteorology and high emissions contributed to the overall poor air quality.

title: Red hair not a cosmetic choice, result of medical condition: Odisha DSP
content: DSP Rashmi Ranjan Das recently addressed online backlash regarding his red hair. He explained it's not a fashion statement but a result of a medical condition that started affecting his hair color years ago. He clarified that his vibrant red locks are due to health issues, not a deliberate cosmetic choice.

title: 2-inch land row: Patna man kills 2 over boundary dispute; 1 injured
content: In a tragic turn of events, a small dispute over just two inches of land in Patna‚Äôs Fatuha area erupted into violence, resulting in the death of a 50-year-old woman and her neighbor.

title: Major setback for Pakistan ahead of virtual knockout vs India in U-19 World Cup
content: Pakistan's Under-19 World Cup hopes face a blow as wicketkeeper-batter Mohammad Shayan is ruled out due to a fractured nose. This setback comes ahead of their crucial virtual knockout match against India, which will decide the final semi-finalist. Afghanistan and England have already secured their spots in the final four.

title: 'Kept briefcase with pistol close': How Bengaluru businessman's final hours unfolded
content: Confident Group chairman C J Roy, 57, was found dead from a gunshot wound at his Bengaluru office on Friday. The incident occurred shortly after Income Tax officials, who had been conducting searches for three days, asked him to stay to review documents. Roy reportedly went into his cabin and a gunshot was heard minutes later.

title: Op Trashi-I Day 14: Security forces make contact with terrorists in J&K's Dolgam
content: Security forces re-established contact with terrorists early Saturday in Dolgam, Jammu and Kashmir, initiating Operation Trashi-I. This follows an intensified anti-terror operation in Kishtwar against Jaish terrorists, which saw internet services suspended. Previous encounters in Kishtwar, despite challenging terrain and casualties, resulted in militants evading capture.

title: Landslide leads to mine collapse in Congo; over 200 killed
content: A devastating landslide caused a mine collapse in Rubaya, eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. Over 200 people, including miners, children, and market women, lost their lives. The incident occurred at a coltan mine, a vital source for global technology. Authorities are still assessing the exact casualty count. The collapse is attributed to heavy seasonal rains weakening the ground.

title: 'Gambhir under lot of pressure': Bavuma fires warning at India head coach
content: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma believes Indian coach Gautam Gambhir faces significant pressure in Test cricket, despite white-ball successes. Bavuma suggests Gambhir needs time to navigate the team's transition, with limited-overs strength potentially offering breathing room. He advocates for continuity in coaching roles, backing Gambhir through the challenging red-ball period.

title: Trump administration to add roughly 65,000 H-2B guest worker visas this year
content: The Trump administration is releasing an additional 65,000 H-2B seasonal guest worker visas, nearly doubling the annual allocation. This move aims to alleviate financial hardship for businesses in sectors like hospitality and construction, which have reported labor shortages. The decision comes amidst broader immigration policies and follows similar visa expansions under previous administrations.

title: Delhi man critical after taking HIV preventive drugs on AI advice
content: A man in Delhi is battling a severe health crisis after taking HIV post-exposure medication without a prescription, guided by an AI chatbot. This reckless decision led to a rare and serious condition known as Stevens-Johnson syndrome.

title: Magha Purnima 2026: Date, timings, puja rituals, and significance
content: Magha Purnima, a highly auspicious day in Hinduism, falls on February 1, 2026. Devotees will observe fasts, perform Satyanarayan Puja, and take holy dips in sacred rivers like the Ganga. This day marks the culmination of the Magha Mela in Prayagraj, offering spiritual cleansing and blessings from Lord Vishnu and the Moon.

title: MLB trade rumors: Braves eye $35m Cubs star; Robert Suarez key trade asset
content: A hypothetical trade sees the Atlanta Braves acquiring versatile infielder Nico Hoerner from the Chicago Cubs for hard-throwing reliever Robert Suarez. This move addresses Atlanta's infield void due to injury, while Chicago secures a much-needed closer. Both players are in their prime with multi-year control, making it a balanced, win-now exchange.

title: 'Emotionally exhausted': Travis Kelce spoke to Taylor Swift‚Äôs parents for support?
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce got engaged in August 2025 and many expected the two to tie the knot this summer. Now, roughly six months after the lavish proposal, it seems the high profile couple are going through a rough patch as Travis Kelce deals with retirement rumors while Taylor Swift goes through legal trouble and might be called to court.

title: NHL trade rumors: Artemi Panarin seeks $50m extension, complicates talks
content: Star player Artemi Panarin seeks a massive $50 million contract extension. This demand complicates his potential trade from the New York Rangers. Several teams have expressed interest in acquiring Panarin. The Florida Panthers are reportedly a top choice for the player. Panarin is in the final year of his current contract. His future team will be decided soon.

title: Bahraini rapper enters Guinness World Records as Fa9la from Dhurandhar tops charts
content: Bahraini rapper Flipperachi has officially entered the Guinness World Records after his song Fa9la (pronounced Faasla), featured in Ranveer Singh‚Äôs blockbuster Dhurandhar, topped the Arabia Charts with the highest number of billboards. The achievement has propelled the artist into the spotlight in India, where the track has gone viral alongside Akshaye Khanna‚Äôs now-iconic entry sequence in the film.

title: Working towards first uncrewed mission for Gaganyaan programme: ISRO Chairman
content: On the PSLV-C62 mission, which suffered an anomaly in the third stage of the rocket after lift-off on January 12, he said scientists were studying everything on the mission to put things in order

content: The incident occurred around 8.10 a.m. at the Badlapur railway station, an official from the Kalyan GRP said

content: Stressing the need to remove the physical, social, informational, and attitudinal barriers to enable every traveller to explore the world with dignity and independence, Minister Mohamed Riyas reminded that the right to travel safely, comfortably, and with dignity belongs to everyone

content: According to police, two groups of customers, allegedly under the influence of alcohol, entered into a heated argument over the delay in serving food

content: The meteorological department has forecast light to moderate rain or snow, especially in the higher reaches

content: A compilation of The Hindu‚Äôs coverage on the death of Confident Group chairperson, who allegedly shot himself to death on January 30, 2026, even as I-T search operations were ongoing at his Bengaluru office premises

title: Arunachal Pradesh CM Pema Khandu reviews hydropower projects
content: The projects reviewed by the Chief Minister of Arunachal Pradesh included the 3,097 MW Etalin Hydroelectric Project and the 680 MW Attunli HEP, which are under implementation

content: State governments will be anxiously awaiting what awaits them since the Finance Minister will be announcing the implementation of the recommendations of the 16th Finance Commission, Jairam Ramesh said

content: Parliamentarians have often played exhibition matches for various causes and there have been several instances of politicians showing great skill on the cricket pitch

content: After the RLM chief‚Äôs son was made the minister in November 2025, seven members of his RLM resigned, accusing the party‚Äôs chief of promoting dynastic politics.

content: The Economic Survey 2025-26, presented by Chief Economic Adviser V. Anantha Nageswaran, offers a calm, data-driven assessment of India‚Äôs economic prospects amid global uncertainty.

title: India gets Ramsar tag for two wetlands, PM Modi lauds efforts
content: The designation of these two sites under the Ramsar Convention takes the total number of such wetlands in India to 98

title: Union Budget 2026: Karnataka Planters‚Äô Association, farmers expect climate-linked insurance cover for coffee
content: The Union government should make regulatory changes and include coffee, tea, and rubber under PMFBY, wherein 80% to 90% of premiums are paid by governments, say planters

title: Regime in tough spot as every Iranian has been affected by economic collapse, says Scott Anderson

title: 50 years ago, on this day, for the first time a government was dismissed in Tamil Nadu
content: ‚ÄúThis is the first time that Tamil Nadu has been brought under President‚Äôs Rule. Though the five-year term of the State Assembly was due to expire on March 21, the Centre has taken this action to dissolve it because of the serious situation that has arisen in the State in terms of the Governor‚Äôs report,‚Äù¬†The Hindu‚Äôs New Delhi Correspondent G.K. Reddy reported on the front page of its edition dated February 1, 1976.

title: 2026 UGC equity rules: Cracks on campus
content: Students from the general category or upper castes believe that the UGC‚Äôs 2026 regulations, introduced mainly to address caste discrimination on campuses, will create a divide and villainise them. They worry about several of its provisions, including the lack of protection against false complaints. While the Supreme Court has stayed the regulations, anger has not yet subsided, report Abhinay Lakshman and Mayank Kumar

title: BJP MLA confronts U.P. Minister over delayed water projects in Mahoba, video went viral
content: After the video of the incident went viral, the Samajwadi Party (SP) president Akhilesh Yadav targeted the BJP government, alleging that BJP ministers or MLAs are busy making money and grabbing land, with none of them are working for the public or for development needs.

title: A soldier few know, a record few can match: Brigadier Henry Bhaskar‚Äôs journey through two wars and beyond
content: A frontline officer in the 1965 and 1971 wars, Brigadier Bhaskar went on to become the first chairman of the Chittagong Port Trust in newly liberated Bangladesh after leading Indian troops into the strategic harbour city

title: When the sea became a shared responsibility for scientists and people living along the coast
content: Over the past two decades, INCOIS‚Äôs Wave Monitoring Along Nearshore (WAMAN) buoy network has been transforming India‚Äôs coastal forecasting by combining science with community trust. With 17 nearshore buoys and active local participation, WAMAN delivers real-time wave data that strengthens early warnings, supports fishers and ports, and ensures long-term, sustainable ocean observation

title: WWE 'SmackDown': Live results and analysis
content: The go-home "SmackDown" ahead of the Royal Rumble ended in chaos, potentially a sign of things to come on Saturday at Royal Rumble. Drew McIntyre dragged Sami Zayn out of the ring during an 8-man tag main event featuring The Vision challenging Zayn, Cody Rhodes, Randy Orton and Jey Uso, which led to a DQ. Jacob Fatu joined the fun and attacked McIntyre, with& Bron Breakker closing "SmackDown" by spearing Rhodes and Zayn. Earlier in the show, Carmelo Hayes defended his United States Championship against Rey Fenix in an open challenge match, AJ Styles and Gunther traded verbal jabs on the mic, and the team of Charlotte Flair and Alexa Bliss defeated Liv Morgan and Roxanne Perez from The Judgement Day. Arda Ocal broke down all the action from "SmackDown" in Riyadh.
